nodes.bodyText: I suggest you add explicitly that the class has to be resolved unconditionally if it's a value type, regardless of whether the value is null, just to make it clear.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -2357,7 +2357,8 @@ TR_J9ByteCodeIlGenerator::genCheckCast()
  * Generate IL for a checkcast bytecode instruction.
  *
  * If the class specified in the bytecode is unresolved, this leaves out the
- * ResolveCHK since it has to be conditional on a non-null object.
+ * ResolveCHK since it has to be conditional on a non-null object when it is
+ * not a value type.

nodes.bodyText: Why can we not use loadClassObject here?

loadClassObject() pushes a node to the stack. The symbolic reference would be pushed on the top of the stack instead of the objectref before the NULLCHK node creation. passThruNode’s child becomes the symbolic reference, instead of objectRef. NULLCHK’s grandchild node ends up being wrong.

@a7ehuo thanks for the explanation - rather than duplicating this logic inline, I think we should refactor loadSymbol into a loadSymbol and loadSymbolNoPush or something like that. loadSymbol can then call loadSymbolNoPush and then push. That way we can keep all that logic together and avoid creating a case to be missed if we have to change anything about how this works...

so the issue will be that the push in loadClassObject will be onto the real operand stack and that is likely what you want to avoid - you could potentially pop it, but why push to pop... So I think the stack will still be the wrong shape after this if the goal is to load the SymRef without pushing its value onto the simulated operand stack.
On second thought you may be right - test the sequence, but your proposal would be preferable if it works.

The new sequence #10068 (comment) looks good to me. The operation on the stack as below is the same as duplicating loadClassObject logic inline:
Enter genCheckCast(int32_t cpIndex): stack top aconst
===>loadClassObject(): stack top aconst
              - push loadaddr
===>Enter genCheckCast(): stack top loadaddr
               Enter genNodeAndPopChildren(): stack top loadaddr
	            - pop loadaddr
	            - pop aconst
               Exit genNodeAndPopChildren(): stack empty 
	       push aconst
===>Exit genCheckCast(): stack top aconst
Exit genCheckCast(int32_t cpIndex): stack top aconst

  ============================================================
   1: JBcheckcast
   /--- trees inserted ------------------------
      n5n      (  0)  ResolveCHK [#307]                                                                    [0x7f13f1057540] bci=[-1,1,-] rc=0 vc=0 vn=- li=- udi=- nc=1
      n4n      (  2)    loadaddr  unknown class object[#366  unresolved Static] [flags 0x18307 0x0 ]       [0x7f13f10574f0] bci=[-1,1,-] rc=2 vc=0 vn=- li=- udi=- nc=0
      n7n      (  0)  NULLCHK on n3n [#32]                                                                 [0x7f13f10575e0] bci=[-1,1,-] rc=0 vc=0 vn=- li=- udi=- nc=1
      n6n      (  1)    PassThrough                                                                        [0x7f13f1057590] bci=[-1,1,-] rc=1 vc=0 vn=- li=- udi=- nc=1
      n3n      (  2)      aconst NULL                                                                      [0x7f13f10574a0] bci=[-1,0,-] rc=2 vc=0 vn=- li=- udi=- nc=0
      n8n      (  0)  checkcast [#86]                                                                      [0x7f13f1057630] bci=[-1,1,-] rc=0 vc=0 vn=- li=- udi=- nc=2
      n3n      (  2)    ==>aconst NULL
      n4n      (  2)    ==>loadaddr
   /--- stack after ------------------------
   @0 n3n      (  2)  ==>aconst NULL
  ============================================================
